Package game

Class Apple.SpecialApple

java.lang.Object
game.Apple.SpecialApple
Enclosing class:
Apple
public class Apple.SpecialApple extends Object
SpecialApple object is a subclass extending from polygon which paints a pink apple on the board for the snake to eat. When this object collides with the snake class' head, it will be removed from the screen and spawn somewhere else at a random coordinate location.
Author:
Quoc Dang, Anthony Chan

  • Constructor Details

    • SpecialApple

      public SpecialApple(game.Point[] inShape, game.Point inPosition, double inRotation)
      Class constructor for the SpecialApple class that specifies the shape, location, and rotation for the SpecialApple object. This method initializes the position of the SpecialApple as well as the size.
      Parameters:
      inShape - Shape of the SpecialApple.
      inPosition - Location of the SpecialApple.
      inRotation - Rotation of the SpecialApple.

    • SpecialApple

      public SpecialApple()
      Default class constructor for the SpecialApple class that specifies the default shape, location, and rotation for the SpecialApple object.

  • Method Details

    • getNewSpecialApplePosition

      public static game.Point getNewSpecialApplePosition()
      This method will return a random point on the board when the Snake head collides with an apple object. The point will be assigned to a new SpecialApple object.
      Returns:
      new point that is randomized within the borders of the game board.

    • getBG1

      public static int[][] getBG1()
      Returns the coordinate of the SpecialApple.
      Returns:
      2d integer array that corresponds with SpecialApple location.

    • paint

      public void paint(Graphics brush)
      Paints the SpecialApple shape and color with the Graphics object in the parameter. Called in the paint method in HungrySnake which draws out the SpecialApple on to the game board.
      Parameters:
      brush - Object from the graphics class used to paint the object on the screen.
      See Also:
      • in HungrySnake

    • getPoints

      public game.Point[] getPoints()

    • contains

      public boolean contains(game.Point point)

    • rotate

      public void rotate(int degrees)
